page.title: 01A Higher ground rural area
page.content: This section of countryside is a rural area, having no industry other than farming. Large portions of the land are uncultivated grassland supporting mainly sheep and some cattle.Generally the land is hilly, gently rolling, rising at its highest point to something over 233m. where rough pasture and moorland predominates. The one small village in the section comprises an old well-built and flourishing farmstead, with several other homes of varying sizes and a very small old church. The land around the village is cultivated and supports a good harvest of wheat and some oats. The river Greta, running through the middle of the section, provided a variation in scenery and there is a good sprinkling of trees, mainly deciduous, with some plantations on the lower ground.
